intro: Pfeiffera incahuasina var. samaipatana, commonly known as the Samaipata pfeiffera, is a rare flowering plant native to Bolivia. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
